service

Class AbstractService

  • java.lang.Object
    • service.AbstractService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Service
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultService, InMemoryService

    abstract class AbstractService
extends java.lang.Object
implements Service
    Service that implements all read-only methods (this is because for testing, there must be a way to isolate the database from the testing yet still test the service.
    Author:
    Katrina James

      • getStudentByCredentials

        public Student getStudentByCredentials(java.lang.String username,
                              java.lang.String password)
        Gets the student that has matching credentials by searching the BST of students for a student of matching username, then checks if the password matches.
        Specified by:
        getStudentByCredentials in interface Service
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the student to be found.
        password - The password of the student to be found.
        Returns:
        Student with matching credentials, or null if no student is found.

        Specified by:
        getTeacherByCredentials in interface Service
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the teacher to be found.
        password - The password of the teacher to be found.
        Returns:
        Student with matching credentials, or null if no teacher is found with matching credentials.

        Sorts a given array of students using a comparator using a merge sort.

        students - The array of students to be sorted.
        comparator - The comparator that tells the program what method of comparison to use when sorting.
        Returns:

      • slice

              int startIndex,
              int endIndex)
        Slices a given array of students.
        Parameters:
        students - The array of students to be sliced.
        startIndex - The first index of the range (inclusive).
        endIndex - The last index of the range (non-inclusive).
        Returns:
        Sliced array of students by the two indices given.

      • merge

        private Student[] merge(Student[] arrayA,
              Student[] arrayB,
              java.util.Comparator<Student> comparator)
        Merges two arrays of students, putting them in the correct order as specified by the comparator. Helper function for the merge sort.
        Parameters:
        arrayA - The first half of the array of students to be sorted.
        arrayB - The second half ot eh array of students to be sorted.
        comparator - The comparator that tells the program what method of comparison to use when sorting.
        Returns:
        Sorted list of students, by the order specified (ascending or descending).
